ygData.messageBody:
According to Richard Slater:
> First of all I would like to tell the people that complain about druids and
> necros being so much better at soloing (or anything) to just forget your
> wizard and go play a druid or necro. And also, I would like to state what I

Hehe :)

> 1) The fact that the /ooc chat lets everyone discuss the solutions of quests
> or the fact you can buy quest items. I think anyone should be banned if
> they give the solution of a quest out in game, I know we cannot stop the ICQ
> contacts or web sites that do but most of the solutions are givin out in
> game anyways.

That's human nature. Once, I started a paper on "Everquest: a look at the
first telepathic culture" (if you really look at it, Norrathians are
telepaths. We can talk to friends we know across the world, tell and tune
out across wide areas, maintain groups of like minded people we are
instantly in contact with... all this while running, fighting, or reading
books)

> 3) The role playing aspects of the game are very weak, I know that's what I
> long for. When AC comes out I am buying it instantly, it's the type of game
> I am looking forward to. Although I wish they would put a class system or
> race system in.

If you believe that AC will improve on role play, I can already foresee
you'll be hugely disappointed. AC is a direct opposition to EQ, and
is in the same ecological niche in the gaming world - multiplayers hack
and slashs. The same niche will attract the same people. You're going to
get the same powerlevelers, the same campers, the same K00l d00dZ we
have. From what I can see (no beta access), there will be differing
details, but not the huge qualitative difference that exists between
UO and EQ, for example.

> 4) Classes in everquest should have more uniqueness, I don't like the fact
> that wizards are just the masters of DD spells. I think we should get
> something special, anything really. Like special wizard hats or something
> of the sort.

Now that's a complain I can support. We do not have enough "tools" to
roleplay. There's not much difference between characters of different
but similar class. I do hope that increasing power of 3D cards will
lead to an EQ2 that can do this (EQ will never have wide customisation)
